intro: Hieracium diaphanoides subsp. porphyrites, commonly known as the Porphyritic Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive, slightly lobed shape.
